

Use ampersand ONLY in an aligned section.


$$
\begin{aligned}
Odds(+D|R1,R2) & =\frac{Pr(+D|R1,R2)}{Pr(-D|R1,R2)}\\
& =\frac{Pr(R1,R2|+D)Pr(+D)/Pr(R1,R2)}
      {Pr(R1,R2|-D)Pr(-D)/Pr(R1,R2)}\\
& = \frac{Pr(R1,R2|+D)}{Pr(R1,R2|-D)}\ \frac{Pr(+D)}{Pr(-D)}\\
& =LR(R1,R2)\times Odds(+D)
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
LR(R1,R2) &= 
\frac{Pr(R1,R2|+D)}{Pr(R1,R2|-D)}\\
&= \frac{Pr(R1|+D)Pr(R2|+D)}{Pr(R1|-D)Pr(R2|-D)}\\
&= LR(R1) \times LR(R2)
\end{aligned}
$$
Now, suppose the "prior" says that half of the true D's are "hidden" (hD) from the test, instead of detectable (dD).
$$
\newcommand{\OR}{\space \mathrm{or}\space}
\newcommand{\AND}{\space \mathrm{and}\space}
\begin{aligned}
LR(R1,R2)
&= 
\frac{Pr(R1 \AND R2 | dD \OR hD)} 
  {Pr(R1 \AND R2|-D)}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\newcommand{\OR}{\space \mathrm{or}\space}
\newcommand{\AND}{\space \mathrm{and}\space}
\begin{aligned}
Pr(R1 \AND R2 | dD \OR hD)
&= 
\frac{Pr(R1 \AND R2 | dD)Pr(dD)+Pr(R1 \AND R2 | hD)Pr(hD)}
{Pr(dD \OR  hD)
}\\
&= 
\frac{Pr(R1 | dD) ^{2} Pr(dD)+Pr(R1 | hD)Pr(hD)}
{Pr(dD) + Pr(hD)
}\\
\end{aligned}
$$
